titlestmt.titleproper: Gehry Nelson (Doreen) Method of Design-Based Learning (formerly City Building Education™) records
Finding Aid for the Doreen Gehry Nelson Method of Design-Based Learning (formerly City Building Education™) Records LSC.2239
titlestmt.author: Machine-readable finding aid prepared by Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-03-06 13:44:58 -0800.

did.unittitle: Doreen Gehry Nelson Method of Design-Based Learning (formerly City Building Education™) records

physdesc.extent: (93 document boxes, 5 record storage boxes, 10 flat boxes and 1 telescope box)

did.abstract: Doreen Gehry Nelson, Professor of Education and Adjunct Professor in the College of Environmental Design at California Polytechnic University in Pomona and Professor of Design-Based Learning at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena began researching transfer of learning to develop an educational theory, methodology, and practical application for K-12 classroom teachers while working within the Los Angeles Unified School District. She founded the Center for City Building Education™ in 1974 where she pioneered the educational methodology Backwards Thinking™ which led to her development of the educational reform movement called The Doreen Gehry Nelson Method of Design-Based Learning. The collection spans from 1959-2014 and consists of the Center for City Building Education™ (CBE) administrative and research files which include 3,000 CBE slides created by the Office of Ray and Charles Eames, the Doreen Gehry Nelson Method of Design-Based Learning (DBL) California State Polytechnic University and Art Center College of Design files, and publications which document the creation, development, and international implementation of Nelson's educational theories and methodologies.
did.physloc: Portions of the collection stored off-site. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
did.langmaterial: Materials are primarily in English with some reports by the Architecture and Children Network of Sendai in Japanese.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS DIGITAL AND AUDIO MATERIALS: This collection contains both processed and unprocessed digital and audio materials. Digital and audio materials are not currently available for access, unless otherwise noted in a Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the series and file levels. All requests to access processed digital and audio materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Doreen Gehry Nelson Method of Design-Based Learning (formerly City Building Education™) records (Collection 2239). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles. ©Doreen Gehry Nelson. All rights reserved.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.
Processed by Kelly Besser with assistance from Rebecca Bucher, in consultation with Genie Guerard, and under the supervision of Megan Hahn Fraser, 2014.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Doreen Gehry Nelson, a public school teacher who was determined to improve the level of information retention by her students, and to promote their higher-level thinking skills, researched transfer of learning to develop an educational theory, methodology, and practical application for K-12 classroom teachers. She earned her Bachelor of Arts, Arts & Humanities and Elementary Teaching Credential at UCLA in 1959 under the mentorship of Corrine A. Seeds and began her teaching practice at what is today called the UCLA LAB School Corrine A. Seeds Campus. She earned her Master of Arts Degree in Educational Administration with Distinction from California State University, Northridge in 1971.

Early in her career, Nelson taught primary grades at Westminster Elementary School in Venice, California where she began implementing her educational theories and methodologies. Since 1969 she formalized and honed these techniques and focused on training K-12 public school teachers. In 1974 she established the Center for City Building Education™ in Los Angeles where she pioneered the educational methodology Backwards Thinking™ that reversed Benjamin Bloom's taxonomy by starting the learning process with creative thinking. Using the built environment as a metaphor for real-life learning, it was the first federally funded architects-in-schools program.

Nelson, born in Toronto, Canada, is the only sibling of architect Frank Gehry – an early advisor, collaborator, and teacher in the program. She was recognized by The New York Times in 1991 as one of the thirty most innovative educators in the United States, awarded lifetime Honorary Membership in the American Institute of Architects (AIA) in 1996, and received the 2006 California State University Wang Family Excellence Award.

Doreen Gehry Nelson is Professor of Education and Adjunct Professor in the College of Environmental Design at California Polytechnic University in Pomona and Professor of Design-Based Learning at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena. Her research areas in education include transfer of learning, long-term retention of learning, higher-level thinking skills, creativity, critical thinking, design thinking, and Backwards Thinking™. Her work as founder and director of the Center for City Building Education™ led to her development of the educational reform movement called The Doreen Gehry Nelson Method of Design-Based Learning.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Doreen Gehry Nelson Method of Design-Based Learning (formerly City Building Education™) records range in date from 1959-2014. The collection consists of the Center for City Building Education™ (CBE) administrative and research files which include 3,000 CBE slides created by the Office of Ray and Charles Eames, the Doreen Gehry Nelson Method of Design-Based Learning (DBL) California State Polytechnic University and Art Center College of Design files, and publications which document the creation, development, and international implementation of Nelson's educational theories and methodologies.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection has been arranged in the following series:
Series 1: Center City Building Education™ Files
Series 2: The Doreen Gehry Nelson Method of Design-Based Learning Files
Series 3: Publications

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Interview of Corinne A. Seeds [oral history transcript] / Corinne A. Seeds, interviewee. UCLA Oral History Department interview, 1963. UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California Los Angeles.

did.unittitle: Center for City Building Education™ Files

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SERIES CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SUBSERIES CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To access audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes Nelson's files concerning her foundation of City Building Education™ (CBE). Most of these records were previously contained in boxes marked "archives." The creator's existing roughly chronological order has been maintained as well as her file titles.

did.unittitle: Frank Gehry and and Doreen Gehry Nelson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a photocopy of a photo of Gehry Nelson and her brother, Frank Gehry teaching at the Smithsonian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This Open Space proposal for the Broadway Elementary School and the community of Venice, California was created by the Open Space Board of Directors, of which Nelson was a member while she was a teacher at Westminster Elementary School and coordinator of Venice projects for Open Space, a non-profit educational development corporation. The Open Space Board was comprised of educators, parents, and urbanologists who embraced an environmental curriculum and believed that "...public schools are public resources to help shape communities and be shaped by communities."

did.unittitle: A Documentation of the CBEP for the NEA and Humanities within the LAUSD

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials include four copies of A Documentation of the City Building Educational Program for the National Endowment of the Arts (NEA) and Humanities within the Los Angeles Unified School District. This documentation describes the aims and objectives of the City Building Program, funded by the Artists-In-Schools Program of the NEA jointly with the United States Office of Education, through the Los Angeles Unified School District. Two copies are a limited edition set of ten with full color original photographs. Documentation includes work with consultant Architect Frank Gehry, guest lecturer Dr. August Berger from East Los Angeles City College, and Charles Eames' documentation of project activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include press releases for The Center for City Building Educational Programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include CBEP newsletters from school sites and school districts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include letters from Architect Frank Gehry, Los Angeles City Council, philanthropist David Rockefeller, Jr., Designer Charles Eames, California Assemblyman Howard L. Berman, California Senator Newton R. Russell, and Jonas Salk of the Salk Institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include photo release forms for students of the first City Building class.

did.unittitle: CBE Summer Teacher Orientation Workshop booklet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include one workshop booklet for the following project participants: Sulphur Springs Union School District, Compton Unified School District, Los Angeles Unified School District, and St. Augustine-By-The-Sea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documentation includes a brief summary of the CBEP, support from the Sulphur Springs community, a statement on the program's primary goals and educational philosophies, an outline of curriculum, and a response to the program's progress by Project Director Nelson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include stationery samples from the CBEP stationery and the Environmental Goals Committee of the Los Angeles Region Goals Project. Graphic designer Marion Sampler of Victor Gruen and Associates gifted the letterhead design to CBE in 1974.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters of endorsement include correspondence from sculptor Claes Oldenburg, David Rockefeller, Jr., Frank Gehry, Ray Eames, Alan Kay of Apple Computer, Inc., Member of the United States House of Representatives Mel Levine, graphic designer Sheila de Bretteville, artist Judy Chicago, Ms. magazine editor Phyllis Rosser, ABC Unified School District Superintendent Dr. Eugene Tucker, and United States Secretary of Education Richard W. Riley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This booklet includes major fundamentals of the program and models for CBEP activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence from the Internal Revenue Service concerning CBEP status as a non-profit corporation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials include CBE Board of Directors Minutes and sample letterhead and envelopes designed by artist Marion Sampler. The letterhead lists Board Members and Advisory Trustees such as Ray Eames, Frank Gehry, John Goodlad, Jonas Salk, and Gloria Steinem.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include graphic designer Frederick Usher's original prints for CBE curricular maps and flow charts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include transparencies of graphic designer Frederick Usher's original CBE prints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This consulting booklet describes Nelson's work for CBE with a focus on education, design, and creative thinking.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence, registration form, and CBEP Articles of Incorporation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a letter from the California Council of the American Institute of Architects (CCAIA) President Ward W. Deems to Frank O. Gehry concerning his appointment as Chairman of the Environmental Awareness Committee. Doreen Nelson is listed as a committee member.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a description of CBEP and notes on the Eames film.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include charts, copies of The Source newspaper and film cells designed by Nelson's students.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed release forms by parents allow permission for students to participate in film, still photographs, and video documentation of the CBEP.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials include a CBEP report, lists of Board of Directors, Members of the Corporation, and Advisory Trustees as well as correspondence from trustees.

scopecontent.p: These charts describe and illustrate CBE methodology including its system, structure, and process.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.p: One letter from Nelson to Brian Sutton-Smith of the Graduate School of Education at the University of Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a Neutra class list and student evaluations of the class.

scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence with Janis A. Donnaud.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.p: Three Powerful Ideas catalogs discuss the principles and strategies of Alan Kay and Seymour Papert.

scopecontent.p: Photocopies of evaluations of Nelson and Leslie Stoltz's CBE work include letters from students and United States Department of Education Secretary Richard W. Riley.

scopecontent.p: Materials include a site map, slides, a photo master CD, a City Building Program History timeline, and a binder of overhead projector transparencies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include Nelson's handwritten list of items for the CBE archives and a list of teachers, staff, consultants, project participants, and advisory board members who served between 1972 and 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.p: This obituary from The Santa Barbara Independent describes the life of Usher, Jr. who worked with Charles Eames in the 1950s and designed Nelson's first book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence with Shell Publishing, an outline for "Project-based Learning for the 21st Century" and copies of Buck Institute for Education project planning forms.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes correspondence and enclosures from agencies and organizations concerning CBE projects. Files are arranged in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence with Charlotte C. Anderson of the American Bar Association (ABA) and Nelson's manuscript describing her City Building law project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from the American Institute of Architects (AIA) includes Learning About the Built Environment Sourcebook for environmental education. This Sourcebook features the CBEP.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains letters from Associate Professor Peter C. Papademetriou, Rice University School of Architecture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: Institute for Development of Educational Ideas, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence includes letters from Learning About Learning Educational Foundation Director Jearnine Wagner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence with Phyllis F. Rosser and Gloria Steinem's typewritten thoughts on transformational moments and techniques.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include the SimCity 3000 Teacher's Guide by Doreen Nelson and Leslie Stoltz.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence from Gerald W. Elbers, United States Office of Education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes correspondence from CBE trustees, teachers, consultants, designers, architects, museum curators, former students, and federal officials. Files are arranged in alphabetical order by surname.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In addition to typed and handwritten letters from de Bretteville, materials include her curriculum vitae and a "Judy's back in town!" invitation for a celebration in honor of Judy Chicago who founded The Woman's Building in Los Angeles with de Bretteville and Arlene Raven in 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes correspondence, personnel files, contracts, and resumes from former CBE staff and consultants. These files are arranged according to Nelson's existing order.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SUBSERIES CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To access audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of evaluations, reading and mathematics tests, teacher test manuals, standardized test scores, testimonials, lesson plans, transcriptions of reflective discussions and statistical reports concerning the implementation of CBE methodologies at sites such as Sulphur Springs Union School District, ABC Unified School District, California State University (CSU) Long Beach, CSU Dominguez Hills, CSU Los Angeles and in collaboration with the American Bar Association (ABA).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include standardized math and reading tests, answer keys, test scores and evaluation reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include two reports by teacher Eleanor Hughes on the effectiveness of CBE workshops.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include two final evaluation copies by students of the City Building/Career Education Program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include City Building Career Education Program evaluation reports for classes at CSU Long Beach, CSU Dominguez Hills and CSU Los Angeles.

did.unittitle: CB joint sessions final evaluation copy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence from Hiroko Hosoda of the Architecture and Children Network Sendai concerning appreciation for CBE lectures and workshops in Sendai, children's conference buttons, object transformation drawings, a map of Japan and a poster with an illustration of a woman driving a car with two passengers hanging on in the back seat. One passenger exclaims, "No! No!" to which the driver responds, "Sorry, Sorry, I'm a woman driver."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 13 includes two copies of 6 1/2 steps to Academic Achievement through Backwards Thinking™ City Building Education™ by Doreen Nelson with Leslie Stoltz.
Folder 14 includes overheads of the manual for presentations.

did.unittitle: Sections of From Stones to Skyscrapers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials concern the implementation of CBE in collaboration with the American Bar Association (ABA).

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Grant application pages with Nelson's social security number were removed, PII redacted and originals returned to Nelson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records document CBE implementation within the ABC Unified School District.
Box 14: Materials include project proposals, meeting minutes, diagrams and correspondence with the district (1980-1982).

Box 15: Materials include long range training plans, evaluations, transcripts of discussions and workshops, charts, handouts, workshop agendas, press, program and correspondence concerning the Classroom City Demonstration/Workshop at the Biltmore Hotel for the CCAIA convention and experience reports for the United States Office of Education (1979-1983).
Box 16: Materials include evaluations, ABC Community Learning Center Prospectus, consultant reports and a USOE Environmental Education Annual Report(1978-1980).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include inter-office district memos, mentor teacher instructional strategies and a CBE tour invitation.

phystech.p: One audio cassette.

Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence, a transcript of Nelson's speech before the Rockefeller Panel on "The Arts, Education and Americans," and an audiocassette recording of the panel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include transcripts of national figures in conversation with Doreen Nelson and David Rockefeller, Jr. about "The Future of Learning and Schooling in America; U.S. Education Tomorrow: Barebones or Basics?"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 16: Materials include a United States Office of Education (USOE) application for Federal assistance, reports on City Building career education programs on California State University (CSU) campuses, correspondence and program press clippings.
Box 17: Materials include correspondence, experience reports and final reports for City Building career education programs at CSU Los Angeles, CSU Long Beach and CSU Dominguez Hills.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a report from the Chaular Elementary School Bilingual Coordinator concerning its Migrant Education Summer Program work with CBE.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include experience reports for Compton Elementary School and El Segundo Elementary School.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include experience reports for College Intermediate Elementary School.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence, Harvard Professor Dennis Reinhardt's resume and plans for Lowell Massachusetts Public School System involvement with CBE.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence, abstract and budget for CBEP's work with the Law-Related Education Program for the Schools of Maryland, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include student work samples, evaluations and migrant education Stanford Project program descriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include experience reports, proposals and consultant agreements concerning CBE as an alternative approach to bilingual education within the North Monterey County Unified School District. This work was sponsored by the Migrant Education Region I Office, directed by Eduardo Cabrera.

did.materialspec: Materials include the Center for City Building Prospectus and CBE Prospectus Synopsis.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Test scores from folder 13 were removed and returned to the donor. Samples were kept with redactions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence, evaluations and standardized assessments for CBE work with Unified School Districts such as Inglewood, Compton, Long Beach, L.A. City Schools, Montebello, Norwalk/La Mirada, Pasadena, Santa Monica and Sulphur Springs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence, reports and curriculum plans for CBE courses and workshops at various USDs, UCLA Extension, Walker Art Center and Otis/Parsons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 19: Materials include correspondence, photos, maps, newsletters, brochures, magazines and Architecture and Children publications concerning a Japanese - United States cultural and educational grass roots exchange program between the Center for City Building Education and the Architecture and Children Network of Sendai (1993-1997).
Box 20: Materials include Japanese publications, reports, correspondence with Hiroko Hosada of Network Sendai and a photo album (1996-1998).

Box 21: Materials include Architecture and Children Network of Sendai newsletters and report books, letters from Japanese students, Sendai City Board of Education reports and correspondence from Hisako Kaihatsu of Kyoto Research Park (1998-1999).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These East San Gabriel Valley Regional Occupational Program (ROP) files document CBE's staff development and curriculum assistance work shops.
Box 21: Materials include evaluations, sign-in sheets, lesson plans, agendas, worksheets, consultant services agreements and ROP final reports (1997-2000).
Box 22: Materials include evaluations, final reports, agendas, correspondence, a print out of a presentation by Laurel Adler and a Small Learning Communities (SLC) grant application (2000-2003).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes grant proposals arranged in the existing chronological order of the creator by year and then chronologically by unit or type which include University, Fund for the Improvement of Postsecondary Education (FIPSE), and National Endowment for the Arts (NEA).
The following are common file title acronyms:
ARCO - Atlantic Richfield Company
A.I.S.C. - Artists in Schools and Communities
C.A.C. - California Arts Commission
C.C.F. - California Community Foundation
FIPSE - Fund for the Improvement of Postsecondary Education
O.E.G. - Office of Education Grant
U.S.O.E. - United States Office of Education
In order to retain the creator's existing order, this subseries also includes handbooks, booklets, and magazines related to grant proposals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Folder 2: September 1971-June 1972
Folder 3: January 1972-January 1973
Folder 4: September 1971-April 1972
Folder 5: September 1971-June 1972

unittitle.title: A Handbook for City Spirit Facilitators

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: City Spirit is an N.E.A. program initiated to develop a new involvement for the arts in community life. The handbook's reading list includes Nelson's City Building Educational Program because it "...covers extremely well the whole field of working with groups in process."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This N.E.A. report was generated by the Architecture and Environmental Arts Program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This N.E.A. booklet features selected Design Arts Program grants. The CBEP's educational gaming project is described on page 61.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include an N.E.A. magazine which features Design Arts recognized grants.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Box 25: July 1981-December 1983
Box 26: July 1982-December 1982

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These California State Polytechnic University, Pomona grant proposals are for professional development, creative activities, and travel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: FIPSE proposals include A Teacher Peer-Training Program and Lab/Idea Bank, the CREATE/Online project, and Teachers as Designers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes specimens of student work arranged in the existing chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nelson kept these books from her first class as examples.

did.unittitle: Where I want to live assignment
Natural and man-made objects table of contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder includes a contact sheet of images of students and their buildings. Samples of these buildings may be found in boxes 32-34.

did.unittitle: City Planning - Past, Present and Future

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folders include a variety of sample assignments, class work, and homework by Westminster Elementary School students.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a binder of city plans entitled Official Record for the City of Venice from the Office of the City Clerk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This assignment involved students taking photographs of good and bad environments. Contact sheets are attached to these assignments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These handwritten stories were the originals used for Book 1. Some assignments include contact sheets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a contact sheet of student images.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: City Buildings include the following: Two partial circles made of Styrofoam, painted white surround a painted circle with a hamburger on top. Each of the three pieces is adorned with a fabric border. Structures also include a brown Styrofoam hand, a toothpick building, a peace sign, a red and gold dome topped with a Styrofoam ball and blue feather and a floral canopy. Box 109 contains an oversize peace sign.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes lesson plans, summaries, participant work samples, reports, guides, handbooks, contracts, correspondence, brochures, evaluations, programs, and agendas regarding CBE workshops and related presentations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This California School Boards Association (CSBA) and Association of California School Administrators (ACSA) conference marks the first time in its history that school districts were allowed to display educational programs alongside commercial exhibits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a California Association of Compensatory Education (CACE) conference program which features Nelson's workshop, "Application of Academic Skills Through Environmental and Future Oriented Simulation" based on her work with Compton Unified School District.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a California Association for the Gifted (CAG) conference program which features Nelson's two hour program, "City Building Educational Program: A Core Curriculum Integrating Skills of Future Thinking (Invention), Interaction, and Planning."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials include a contract agreement to reimburse CBEP for the Honors Program Faculty Training Institute for the Counseling Department at C.S.U.L.A. and a photo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a poster for the C.S.U.L.A. Conference on Humanistic Education which features Nelson's workshop, "City Building: Environmental Issues, Interaction, Future Thinking."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include two UCLA Extension applications for enrollment in the CBEP's "An Institute in Cooperative Curriculum Design for Teachers, Architects, Designers and Planners."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a report and recommendations on the Public Learning/Graphic Communications Santa Barbara workshop to the Office of Environmental Education, Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include one program for the Built Environment Education Program (BEEP) special summer institute for teachers and administrators. The CBEP workshop was entitled "Creating Instant Cities and Designing in the Classroom with Doreen Nelson."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a Walker Art Center Educational Resources and Services booklet and program pamphlets which feature the Purium Instant City Workshop led by Nelson and architect Frank O. Gehry, Mayor of Purium Instant City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include programs for the 3rd Annual Visual Literacy Conference at California State Polytechnic University, Pomona at which Nelson presented the following session: "Using the 3-Dimensional Living Environment for Learning."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes flyers for events, outlines and transcripts of lectures either by Nelson or about the CBEP.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include once copy of Marlyn Silver's CBEP speech at the California Association of the Gifted (C.A.G.) conference in Monterey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a copy of Nelson's speech before Rockefeller Panel on "The Arts, Education, and Americans."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include Nelson's notes for her CBE presentation to Vice-President Mondale's staff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include an invitation to Nelson's City University of New York (CUNY) Graduate Center film and slide presentation, "The Classroom as the City. The City Building System: A Way to Learn" and a transcript of her lecture and the question and answer session.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include notes for Nelson's lecture in Richard Saul Wurman's class.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include Nelson's notes for her National Council of Social Service (NCSS) talk on community building, "Envisioning the Future."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include an annotated typescript of Nelson's lecture at the Southern California Institute of Architecture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes thousands of color slides of the CBEP. Slides are arranged chronologically and begin with slides taken by the Office of Ray and Charles Eames. Following the Eames Office slides, chronological arrangement begins again for slides taken by Nelson and other CBE employees.

did.unittitle: Slides taken by the Office of Ray and Charles Eames

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 37: Slides include images of Kid City, The Source newspaper "...and a child shall lead us" front page, classroom models and Westminster/Venice final city (1970-1976). The Kid City images provide documentation of the City Buildings created by students which may be found in boxes 32-34.
Box 38: Slides include images from slide carousels A, B and C, Compton USD work and Soledad (1975-1977).

Box 39: Slides include images of teachers, students and city buildings taken by Grant Taylor of the Eames Office. Other images include work at the Mark Taper, with Ruth Hiebert's Theatre Program, Compton USD and California State University.
Box 40-41: Materials include hundreds of matted color slides (circa 1970s).

Box 42: These slides were removed from a metal tin labeled "Not Promising" and include images of Kid City and work at the Mark Taper, Soledad, Compton, and Mitchell object transformations (1970-1977, bulk 1975-1976).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 43: Slides include images of Sand City, Helium City, Westminster Dough Day, Kite Day at the beach with Albert Gregory, Smithsonian Summer Institute adult class, August Berger at Brockton, Warner and Brockton at Frank Gehry's studio/office and Doreen and Frank Gehry at the Smithsonian. The Westminster file includes images of City Buildings which may be found in boxes 32-34 (1969-1974).

Box 44: Slides include Tim Street-Porter originals and images of zoning and mapping exercises, Blimp Day, Fred Usher drawings for CBE book, final cities for Ruth Glatt's class, Mitchell Soledad model sites, Purium, teachers, and graphics from the CBE film (1972-1980, 1988, 1994).

Box 45: Slides include Tom Vinetz originals, images from Ralph Mechur's slide show, the Biltmore Project images of kids as iconic Los Angeles structures with Mayor Tom Bradley, Tim Street-Porter originals, images of the ABC teacher workshop, CBE at Santa Maria High School, the Los Angeles Children's Museum Halloween fundraiser, and key trademark images (1979-1982, 1986, 1988-1989, 1991, 1994-1996).

Box 46: Slides include images of Purium and its creation, Object Transformation, mapping cities, Open School, Don Huey's work, Japan, the Goodyear Blimp, the Marshal Middle School front office, and Leslie Stoltz's class (1989, 1994-1999, 2001).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Photos include color and black and white images of Nelson, students, and teachers engaged with the CBE methodology. Many of these photographs were taken by the Office of Ray and Charles Eames. Contact sheets are also included with the negatives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 47: Materials include ABC USD photos, Westminster Elementary School City Building images, a trademark photo from the first class, a full set of 8 x 10 black and white photos captured by the Office of Ray and Charles Eames which were used for a CBE book, and other photos by the Eames Office such as those of a musical score created by students and the kids at the Claes Oldenburg exhibit.
Box 48: Photos include images of Nelson, the Object Transformation Parade and the ABC USD project, L.A. City Buildings as Body Objects.

Box 49: Materials include photos of Nelson by Robyn Denny for use in a book, images of student work from the S.M. Gifted Program, Cal Poly students wearing objects, migrant education program work, Apple Computer Inc. project workshops, Nelson on strike, at work and with students and Mayor Tom Bradley. Materials also include student photos of their own houses and objects transformed.
Box 50: Photos include black and white photos for use in a book, color photos of student work, the Marshall Middle School front office, for Mrs. Glatt's class, and a binder of contact sheets.

Box 51: Materials include photos of Japan-USA Cultural and Educational Exchange Program work which was sponsored by Japanese and American government agencies and architectural institutes directing the introduction of CBE into the Japanese curriculum.
Box 52: Photos include small color prints from slides, images of work in Japan, Open School projects, head shots of Nelson, and black and white photos taken by the Office of Ray and Charles Eames.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 53: Materials include negatives and contact sheets for CBE's Migrant Education Program work as well as a contract with Climate-Rite, Inc. for storage of negatives in a high-security, climate-controlled vault.
Box 54: Materials include Toronto negatives and oversize contact sheets.
Box 55: Materials include negatives, Building Purium oversize contacts, and oversize contacts from the Office of Ray and Charles Eames.

Box 56: Materials include oversize contacts and negatives, contact sheets from the first workshop at the Neutra House, negatives of Cal Poly students wearing objects, and contact sheets from the Office of Ray and Charles Eames.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SUBSERIES CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This subseries contains both processed and unprocessed audiovisual materials. Audiovisual materials are not currently available for access, unless otherwise noted in a Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the file level. All requests to access processed materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

did.unittitle: City Building: A Way To Learn film

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nelson and David Olney wrote and produced this film through the Office of Ray and Charles Eames.
Folders 1-3: Materials include three 1/4 inch open reel magnetic tapes with narration by Allen Mandel for use with the Eames film.
Folder 4: Materials include one 1/4 inch open reel magnetic tape with narration by Jeremy Blahnk for use with the Eames film.
Folder 5: Materials include two 16 mm film reels labeled "Original City Building Film" and "ABC News 1970."
Folder 6: Materials include one 16 mm film reel entitled "Kid City."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Nelson wrote, directed and produced this ten year longitudinal study film that surveys CBE methods in various classroom settings: traditional, migrant teacher training, and with students with special needs. This film also revisits students from the first CBE class of 1969. Materials include one 16 mm "Answer Print" film reel and two 16 mm reels of additional footage labeled "Roll A," and "Roll B."

Strickland Apple Vivarium - Los Angeles Open School and Recess Incidents in the Playground and RM Strickland Apple Vivarium "Everything is Made Out of Something" City Building Education at L.A. Open School.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Box 62: Materials include eight U-matic videotapes with the following titles: City Building (California Arts Council) Cal Arts Documentation Migrant Ed., CBEP Migrant Education duplicate copy, CB workshop lesson demos, Classroom City film, CB workshop Dr. Tucker, Steps to Learning Episode EL74-23 University of Southern California and R. Strickland Apple Vivarium "Everything is Made Out of Something" City Building at L.A. Open School video excerpts.

Box 63: Materials include four U-matic videotapes with the following titles: ABC Watson, City Building: Classroom City, CB workshop lesson demos and Classroom City support documentation video. This box also includes a 1/2 inch video tape entitled "TV Program."

Materials also include a file on storage of tapes, films and photos with Climate Rite, Inc. Records Management and an audiocassette tape index file.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These files contain Nelson's DBL documentation from Cal Poly Pomona and maintain her existing order. For example, boxes 62-73 are loosely organized alphabetically by file name and include some files concerning Nelson's Art Center DBL work.

scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence, a program, notes and photos concerning City Building's involvement with the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) Exposition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Paul MacCready was an aerospace scientist who championed Nelson's work. Nelson worked on a project with Paul at Mashall Middle School in Pomona Unified School District called "Hamster Driven Aircraft - Doing More with Less." They trained a super star hamster to be a power source for lifting a small aircraft which could fly from one desk to another about one foot off the ground. Their point was to teach students about never before seen ways of finding energy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, clippings, articles, and a MacCready memorial program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a Los Angeles Times obituary for McIntyre, a professor of Nelson's who encouraged her to realize CBE.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence with Rounds of the Milken Family Foundation.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Professor Stephen A. Benton, Head of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) Program in Media Arts & Sciences.

scopecontent.p: Photos, slides and correspondence concerning Nelson's use of the Neutra House for "A City in the Classroom" workshop.

scopecontent.p: Materials include a copy of Davis' "Making a Case for Design-Based Learning."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include The National Endowment for the Arts (NEA) 1965-2000: A Brief Chronology of Federal Support for the Arts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a description of the Curriculum Design credential at Otis/Parsons School of Design in Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include Art Center's Summer Institute for Teachers (SIFT) scholarship brochures.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: In 1978 Peter taught at UCLA and lived in Nelson's house. Nelson corresponded with the Smithsons until they both died. Peter was also friends with Charles Eames but did not know Nelson's brother because in 1978, Frank Gehry was not a household name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence from English architects, Peter and Alison Smithson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence concerning electronic music pioneer Morton Subotnick's visit to the Open School, his research notes on The Unschool of the 21st Century and his article, "Creative Teamwork."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence with Stoltz concerning her work with Nelson, letters regarding Stoltz's funeral services and the Leslie Stoltz Scholarship Fund.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include two Civilization Building Core teacher brochures made by kids.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include thank you cards made by Nelson's students and DBL evaluation forms.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence with Bob Weber of the University's College of Education and School of Law and flyers for Weber's publication, "Forks, Phonographs, & Hot Air Balloons."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include Marshall University "Design Influences" Symposium on Design brochures and related correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include a review of Nelson's Transformations book and a letter from a Whole Earth Review research department staff member.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include brochures and evaluations for the "Spaces and Places: Teaching Art and Design through the Internet" conference at The Frederick R. Weisman Art Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, Nelson's selection committee packet, invitations, guest lists, and CSU programs which feature Nelson as the award recipient for Education, and Professional and Applied Sciences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 9 includes a letter of support from Apple Fellow Alan Kay.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven DBL MA posters announce Design and Creativity in Education courses at Cal Poly Pomona.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folders 1-5: Slides of Cal Poly Pomona M.A. students.
Folders 6-8: Photos of Nelson with her M.A. students, U.S.-Japan Architecture and Children International Symposium, and curriculum maps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Box 87: Thirteen VHS tapes include the following titles: Final presentation course #2, Presentation of lesson course #1, D. Nelson M.A. class, Design World, Alan Kay, Martin Haberly, Michael Eisenberg, Betty Edwards Drawing Demo, Jerry Yang, Herb Kohl and Monton Subot.
Box 88: Twelve VHS tapes include the following titles: ROP Design Based, DBL Promo, Flying Free, Ron Hockwalt, Macready Sturges, Laurel Adler and Sue Griffin.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes flyers, publications, mailers, programs, brochures, agendas and evaluations for Nelson's DBL Kids Program, Learning Lab, and Summer Institute for Teachers (SIFT) at Art Center College of Design.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: SUBSERIES CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To access audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder 3 includes evaluations, brochures and agendas for Nelson's first DBL Summer Institute for Teachers.
Folder 4 contains nine Summer Institute mailers.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fifteen CDs, six DVDs, three zip discs, three Mini DVs and one Hi8 cassette provide documentation of Nelson's DBL Art Center work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The publications series includes books, magazines, journals, reports, newspapers and clippings collected by Nelson. Almost all publications either include articles on Nelson's work with CBE and DBL or were created by Nelson.

unittitle.title: Educational Goals in an Urban Setting

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two copies of Nelson's M.A. thesis wherein Nelson presents the theoretical educational model which provides the framework that informed her CBE methodology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These folders each contain one copy of a paper Nelson wrote for her Master's program entitled, "A Future Model of Schools."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Source newspaper was a Venice publication by Citizens for Political Integrity. The front page of this issue features the headline, "..and a child shall lead us" for a story about the CBE work Nelson's students were engaged with while working on a Master Plan for Venice. The editorial page highlights Nelson's Westminster Elementary School fifth and sixth grade students' letters to Mayor Yorty and Councilman Braude concerning their visions for the future of Venice.

did.unittitle: Claes Oldenburg and L.A. architecture clippings

scopecontent.p: Materials include the book by Nelson and her brother Frank Gehry, correspondence, and paste-up boards.
